procmon-processes-top.description: Top level grouping for attributes for processes.

processes.description: Parameters related to all monitored processes

pid.description: Reference to the process pid key

state.description: State parameters related to monitored processes

procmon-process-attributes-state.description: Attributes state definitions for a process

items.description:
Current process command line arguments.  Arguments with
a parameter (e.g., --option 10  or -option=10) should be
represented as a single element of the list with the
argument name and parameter together.  Flag arguments, i.e.,
those without a parameter should also be in their own list
element.

start-time.description:
The time at which this process started,
reported as nanoseconds since the UNIX epoch.  The
system must be synchronized such that the start-time
can be reported accurately, otherwise it should not be
reported.

uptime.description: Amount of time elapsed since this process started.

cpu-usage-user.description: CPU time consumed by this process in user mode.

cpu-usage-system.description: CPU time consumed by this process in kernel mode.

cpu-utilization.description: The percentage of CPU that is being used by the process.

memory-usage.description: Bytes allocated and still in use by the process

memory-utilization.description: The percentage of RAM that is being used by the process.
